intro: Oxydectes wilsonii, commonly known as Wilson's oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features include stipules and a unique arrangement of leaflets. Oxydectes wilsonii is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
